name: Channel pattern
functionStatement: Examines the role of bank processes and erosion in channel change. Observes patterns in sinuosity and curvature affecting habitat complexity.
descriptionMarkdown: Assesses whether planform and number of active threads match the natural setting, considering straightening, braiding, and side-channel connectivity.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Use recent imagery and field checks to compare current planform to historic; note straightened segments, thread count, bar/island patterns, and whether side channels connect at about bankfull.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Heavily straightened or artificial planform.
Criteria: Strongly out of character; side channels absent or blocked by berms/spoil/levees.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Clear realignment or planform departure; side channels mostly inactive.
Criteria: Long straight segments or mismatched thread count; side channels disconnected except larger floods.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Some simplified segments but generally natural.
Criteria: Minor realignment or slight thread-count departure; limited side-channel connectivity.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Planform natural for valley; expected thread count; side channels connected.
Criteria: Little/no straightening; side channels carry water near bankfull; pattern matches reference.
